bent.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the past tense and past participle of bend
bent.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Stand with your knees slightly bent.
He breathed in deeply, bent double in pain  (=with the top part of your body leaning forward towards your legs).
a bent old man  (=not standing straight)
bent.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: financially dishonest and willing to use your official position unfairly
bent.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: The knife was bent in the middle.
She kept her head bent so that Josie couldn’t see her face.
having a bent shape that turns around – used especially when something has been damaged or is old and has lost its natural straight shape
All that was left was a pile of twisted metal.
bent in the shape of part of a circle, especially naturally or because something has been made that way
The bird has a long curved bill.
bent or twisted into the wrong shape because of heat or dryness
The windows are warped and won’t open anymore.
not straight, but bending sharply in one or more places, especially in a way that looks different from normal or does not look right – often used about a part of someone’s body, a path, or a picture
her crooked nose and long thin face
The boys at school used to make fun of me because I have a crooked spine.
The picture looks crooked - can you move it up on the left?
the narrow crooked streets of the financial district
having smooth bends in it, usually in a regular pattern – used about hair or lines
The pictures were separated by a thin wavy line.
bent.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: special natural skill or interest in a particular area
bent.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: readers of a more literary bent
